Title: Infographic in relation to the human information - Processing system and its effectiveness to deliver complex information
Affiliations: New Media Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adi, D., New Media Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ariesta, I., New Media Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Infographic as a form of presenting information that is designed combining visual with text has become a form that allows the reader easily understand series or complex information. This paper will begin with brief explanation about how the brain processes the information and the history of Infographic that has become part of the visual communication design heritage. Then will be discussed how infographic both on printed and digital media convey comprehensive information that related to the human information - processing system. At the end of the article can be obtained a clearer picture on how infographic with its visual approach makes impacts to the reader, in order to understand complex information. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Bionics; Digital storage; Visual communication; Brain process; Complex information; Comprehensive information; Human information processing; Infographic; Presenting informations; Visual communication designs; Partial discharges
Funding Details:
Office of Technology Transfer and Procurement

Binus University
Funding Text 1: The authors would like to appreciate the Research and Technology Transfer Office and Bina Nusantara University for providing financial support for the research.
References: Malamed, C., (2009) Visual Language for Designer, pp. 20-25; Hall, A., (2011) Illustration, 8; Malamed, C., (2009) Visual Language for Designer, p. 26; Smiciklas, M., (2012) The Power of Infographics, pp. 3-5; Lankow, J., Ritchie, J., Crooks, R., (2012) Infographics: The Power of Visual Storytelling; Smiciklas, M., (2012) The Power of Infographics, pp. 6-9; Alan, M., (2007) Illustration: A Theoretical & Contextual Perspective
Conference name: 1st International Conference on Advance and Scientific Innovation, ICASI 2018

Title: Designing edugraphic using thinking map applied in the case of knowledge about Indonesian hero for elementary school as an effective media
Affiliations: New Media Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara Univeristy, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ariesta, I., New Media Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara Univeristy, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Adi, D., New Media Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara Univeristy, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In this paper, the material of the book in the form of long text is transformed into education graphic (edugraphic) by using thinking map and applying design principles. The goal is to parse the intent of complex text lessons into more effective and understandable forms. The use of thinking map is specifically the tree map, bubble map, flow map and brace map which is then also applied the design principle, which uses character illustration and place focused on simple outline, hierarchy of information by using typography and line and shape as navigation map thinking in one edugraphic. The results show a communication creation that the content is more simple than long text because the intent of the content of knowledge has been conveyed through the thinking map and design principles. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Design Principles; Effective media; Elementary schools; Navigation map; Tree-maps; Physics
Funding Details:
Office of Technology Transfer and Procurement

Binus University
Funding Text 1: The authors would like to appreciate the Research and Technology Transfer Office and Bina Nusantara University for providing financial support for the research.

Conference name: 1st International Conference on Advance and Scientific Innovation, ICASI 2018

Title: Development of Japanese comic as an illustration and cultural ideology propaganda
Affiliations: School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pratama, W., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suprayitno, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Adi, D., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9, Palmerah-Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Illustration, a picture with a specific message, has become a part of the information delivery since thousands of yearago. The visual becomes graphic narrative means the image composition is modified in such a way as to produce story and message. Comic is a visual illustration that created moves or sequential story as a way to strengthen its message, ideology, and propaganda as well as the story. Japan as a developed country in Asia is trying to implement the modernization of the visual narrative in the industrial sector. They maintain a cultural identity that packaged by cultural mixing with modernity understanding. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
References: Ajidarma, S.G., (2005) Tiga Panji Tengkorak: Kebudayaan Dalam Perbincangan, , Disertasi Doktor Fakultas Ilmu Pengetahuan Budaya Universitas Indonesia, Depok; Atmowiloto, A., (1982), pp. 109-120. , Komik dan Kebudayaan Nasional, Analisis Kebudayaan, Tahun II, Nomor 1-1981/1982; Bonneff, M., Indonesia, K., (1998), Kepustakaan Populer Gramedia (KPG), Jakarta; Eisner, W., (1985) Comics and Sequential Art, , W.W. Norton & Company, New York; Getlein, M., (2010) Living with Art 9Th Edition, , McGraw-Hill Higher Education, New York; Jono Irianto, A., (2002), Pendobrakan Batas Batas Seni Rendah dan Seni Tinggi, Aspek-aspek Seni Visual Indonesia, Paradigma dan Pasar, Penerbit Yayasan Cemeti Yogyakarta, Yogyakarta; Kosasih, R.A., (2004), Udrayana: Buku 1, Elex Media Komputindo, Jakarta; Kranz, S., (1974) Science and Technology in the Arts; a Tour Trough the Realm of Science/Art, , Van Nostrand Publisher Company, Boston; Kleiner, F., History, A., (2006) Art through the Ages, , Wadsworth Cengage Learning, Boston; McCloud, S., (1993) Understanding Comic: Invisible Art, , Harper, New York; Rizali, N., (2003) Seni: Estetika, Etika Dan Logika, 3, p. 1; Soemardjo, J., (1999), Filsafat Seni, Penerbit ITB, Bandung; Yogyakarta, Y.C., (2002), Aspek-aspek Seni Visual Indonesia, Identitas dan Budaya Massa, Penerbit Yayasan Cemeti Yogyakarta, Yogyakarta

Authors: Adi D., Pratama W., Suprayitno, Wijasa H.K.S.
Title: Interpretation from the illustrations of Soeharto on the cover of TEMPO, an independent Indonesian weekly news magazine
Affiliations: School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adi, D., School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pratama, W., School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suprayitno, School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijasa, H.K.S., School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The illustration on the cover of a magazine is to give identity and also to attract attention which requires synergy between writers and artists in order to deliver messages in visual language. This paper will discuss the illustration and visual language as well as and readers interpretation and the impact to the media where the illustration is displayed. The study was conducted qualitative research method from Illustrations of former President Soeharto on Tempo magazines covers after his resignation until his death in 2008 as a case study, and the cover of Soeharto in New Order era as a comparison. From the research is expected to obtain an overview of how the message is delivered using visual language in the illustration and its impact to the reader. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
References: Hall, A., (2011) Illustration, , Laurence King Publisher, London, UK; Male, A., (2007) Illustration: A Theoretical and Contextual Perspective, AVA Publishing, , Lausanne, Switzerland; Steele, J., (2005) Wars Within: The Story of Tempo, an Independent Magazine in Soeharto’s Indonesia, , Equinox Publishing, Jakarta; (2011), 2, p. 925. , ISSN 2087-1236; (2008) Pemimpin Redaksi Majalah Tempo Minta Maaf,” TEMPO, , http://www.tempo.co/read/news/2008/02/05/055116950/Pemimpin-Redaksi-Majalah-Tempo-Minta-Maaf, February 8; www.komisiinformasi.go.id/regulasi/download/id/140
Correspondence Address: Adi, D.; School of Design Bina Nusantara University, Jl. KH Syahdan No. 9 Palmerah, Indonesia
